tr: (used of soaps or cleaning agents) having a substance (an abrasive or filler) added to increase effectiveness

example: reinforced concrete contains steel bars or metal netting

example.ex: A stronger European Parliament would, they fear, only reinforce the power of the larger countries...
example.tran: 他们担心一个更加强大的欧洲议会只会增强大国的力量。

example.ex: This sense of privilege tends to be reinforced by the outside world.
example.tran: 这种优越感往往会被外部世界强化。

value.def: If something reinforces a feeling, situation, or process, it makes it stronger or more intense.

example.ex: ...films that reinforce the idea that we live in a threatening and risky world.
example.tran: 让我们更加意识到自己生活的世界充满威胁和危险的电影

value.def: If something reinforces an idea or point of view, it provides more evidence or support for it.
value.tran: 给予…更多支持;为…提供更多证据

example.ex: Eventually, they had to reinforce the walls with exterior beams.
example.tran: 最终，他们不得不通过增加外梁来对墙体进行加固。

value.def: To reinforce an object means to make it stronger or harder.

example.ex: Its windows were of reinforced glass.
example.tran: 它的窗户装的是强化玻璃。

example.ex: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting...
example.tran: 双方经过昨天的激战后都在向各自的阵地增派兵力。

example.ex: Troops and police have been reinforced in the southern Pakistan city of Hyderabad.
example.tran: 巴基斯坦南部的海得拉巴市已增派了军队和警力。

value.def: To reinforce an army or a police force means to make it stronger by increasing its size or providing it with more weapons. To reinforce a position or place means to make it stronger by sending more soldiers or weapons.
value.tran: 为(军队或警察队伍)增加力量（或装备）；向（某地）增兵;增援
